intro: Hieracium hispidiceps, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium hispidiceps is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
